intro: Cinnamomum maheanum, commonly known as the Madagascar cinnamon or Mahé cinnamon, is a small evergreen tree native to the island of Madagascar. It belongs to the樟科 (Lauraceae) family and is characterized by its aromatic leaves and bark. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers followed by oval-shaped berries containing dark purple seeds. Its essential oils, extracted from the leaves and bark, are valued for their aromatic and medicinal properties. Due to its limited natural range and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
